subject: Re: [junit] Combine textui and swingui advantages?
msgSnippet: ... My suggestion has the advantage of being free.... :) -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
messageBody:
Shane Mingins wrote:

>
> --- gundoroff <gundoroff@...> wrote:
> > Is there any way to run tests using the
> > junit.swingui.TestRunner with
> > having the short summary of found errors and falures
> > in my console
> > (e.g. Messages Log in JDeveloper), like as using
> > junit.textui.TestRunner?
> > In other words, how to have swingui and textui both?
> >
>
> Use Intellij Idea http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/
> instead ;-) ... I think you may find the integration
> of JUnit to be what you are after.

My suggestion has the advantage of being free.... :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
